comment: The absolute worst professor I've ever had. If you turn things in on the due date given, it is considered late. The day final grades were do (12/13/18), he sent out an announcement before posting grades, saying that he would be out of the office until 1/7/19 and we would have to wait to ask him questions about the class until then. AVOID TAKING!!!
Really hard class!

This teacher is unbelievable. I think he actually randomly chooses grades for assignments. If you do not turn in your assignment a week before the due date, points are taken off. Never responds to emails and when he does, hes extremely rude and tells you youre capable of withdrawling if you want. Worst professor Ive ever had to deal with it.

Terrible professor. You literally get points off for turning things at the last minute or even the day its due. He wants you turning things in days in advance. In the real world, if you submit something by the deadline, you dont get punished for it. But you do in this class. Very poor communication and very vague. Tough grader. A sorry teacher.

Snuck in a assignment requiring students to do 100% of discussion for a group project on a d2l discussion board. Since no one would ever do that and our group chose GroupMe, we all lost a letter grade. Professor never responded to a single email from anyone.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: 6 module quizzes (that you can find answers for online) and a group project. Nothing major. Not really involved, but seems to be a decent guy. You'll pass if you put in a little work.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I will put it this way. As a Senior I received my first C at KSU. Module quizzes are near impossible unless you have a photographic memory. Little to no engagement throughout the semester.
Took this as an online class. Terrible. Vague instructions on projects and did not provide powerpoint or lecture notes.

I took this class online. Tests are very tough!! Discussions and reports are easy, just don't write a simple paragraph and put forth a little effort and you'll get a good grade. Must comment on other students post a couple days before deadline for a good grade, not the night its due. 1 group project that is not tough.

I'm so upset with this "teacher".  I am a hardworking student and he was completely unsympathetic to my requests for help.  Extra credit? Ha! He was rude to my group despite our tactful messages and was frankly no help at all.  Instructions for his group project are convoluted, making it nearly impossible for us to complete it. SAVE YOURSELF!!

DO NOT TAKE HIM unless you want to teach yourself! I am not even exaggerating, he did not do ANY online lectures, PowerPoints, or anything. I had to teach myself! His tests are unbelievably hard!!! He does not clarify what he expects of his students but demands a lot. However he is a nice person, just not a good professor.

This professor is the WORST. Group project that he gives no instruction for. Discussions and papers with 1 line as a prompt and barely and explanation, and he then grades as if he gave a crystal clear explanation. Only midterm and final. Class average on midterm was 63 and he says that is "consistent with past semesters" OBVIOUSLY THE PROB IS YOU!

I'm not sure how this class is in-person, but I had a terrible online experience. The professor made no contact the entire semester and we had a huge project due that had no instructions. The tests were impossibly hard and had no relation to the text AT ALL! I learned nothing in this class and got a B.

We didn't require a book for studying, and he spends a lot of time on random that don't have much to do with tests, so I just used class notes.  Tests were 100% essay, not my forte, but he doesn't grade to harshly as long as you communicate the general idea.  Classes were very boring, not especially helpful for MKTG, but not terribly difficult.

Worst teacher in history. He is rude, condescending and he doesn't even take an interest. I did well on most assignments. There was one where there was no due date, yet he still gave me a zero. How the heck does that work? I'm sorry, but it's not my fault you forgot to put a due date. I had other stuff to do and wanted to have time to do it right.

Mathisen was the man. No his class is not the easiest as you must attend and take good notes to do well (however class always let out real early). 2 tests (6 q's you choose 4 of them to answer in a essay/chart) and a group presentation. He is not a easy grader but you know what to expect on the exams so its not bad just write everything down.

Overall okay class. Professor talks a lot and does not keep to the Power Points. Never uses the book. Tests are from your notes only. Gets off topic a lot. Marketing simulation game is A LOT of work, as are the presentations. You can get a good grade but this class requires a lot of hours outside of class due to simulation game/presentations.

Dr. Mathisen is a very nice guy.  The lectures are pleasant.  The "Marketing Game" simulation is very time consuming.  It appears antiquated, but you actually learn more than you might expect.  The tests are of moderate difficulty.

Professor Mathisen is super sweet! Go to class, take notes, and you will earn an A. He tells a lot of stories that relates to the material and I advise you to jot those down and relate them on the exams. Attendance is important because you are going to be tested on information he provides during class time & not information from a textbook.
There is no book used in this class...  Only what the professor writes on the board.  If you are not a good note-taker, go somewhere else.  He is a very knowledgeable person though!

If you don't buy the book plan on attending class everyday. Basically memorize your notes and write down everything he puts on the board and you are golden. The presentation and case study is as difficult as you make it. He grades pretty easy and says he doesn't like to fail students. Extremely boring teacher, but not too bad of a class.

Don't waste your money on the text.  Just write what he puts on the board, it'll be exactly what he asks on the test.  Tests are essays that you can draw pictures and give bullet points.  Simulation is easy.  One group project thats simple and he doesn't grade it hard.  Recommended!

The absolute most BORING professor on Earth!!! Class is a struggle to sit through, but he never uses the whole hour and 15 minutes. Tests are essays and kind of hard because his notes aren't descriptive. Write everything he puts on the board and memorize it for the essays. Project is a joke.

Great professor.  At first was very frustrated with the way we were taught.  The professor encouraged you to come up with outrageous ideas for the project.  Then he would show how thses outrageous ideas could actually be used.  Truly taught me a new way of looking at things.  Mathisen is a good professor.

love this teacher. CLass was easy going. THere is one project were you just put all your mkting ideas together and present it to final client. Class never took more than 2 hrs. VEry open to ideas. Exams very fair. Dont need book.

Regurgitate on tests, projects are silly.  A group couldn't keep a straight face when presenting their massage spa presentation made a better grade than my group.  Don't buy the book, enjoy his stories, but don't expect to learn anything.

The prof was interesting but extremely hard to follow. He would talk for two hours and I would come away with about a half a page of notes. Tough to figure out what to study. Don't apply creativity or thought to the test. Just regurgitate what he lectured in class. Don't even think about buying the book.

This is by far the worst class I have ever taken in my Grad program.  I had no clue what he was talking about the entire semester & neither did anyone I sat near.  His tangets made it very difficult to pay attention and to pick out what was actually relevant to the course.  The only good part of the course is that I didn't buy a book.

No book required but you have to take a lot of notes.  Sometimes he gets off track and it's hard to remember what the original point was.  Tests are all essays.  Gives you 6 questions and you have to answer 4.  Strick memorization if you take good notes.  2 exams and a group project.  This was not one of my favorite classes.
Talks highly of himself and his research.  Learned nothing new in the class.

I'd stay away from him.  He is knowledgeable, but examples and stories are very old-more talk about the telephone-TV thing and I would scream. He dumbed down the content - no 2nd test - and didn't convey much info in the 2nd half of the semester. I almost feel I wasted my money in this class. An example of why KSU is a 3rd Tier school.Disappointed.

I had mathison for 2 classes. I dont see how anyone can say he is boring. He brings some real life experiance to the class room and I learned a lot from him. The only negitive thing I have to say is he gets long winded sometimes and goes off topic. But over all an excellent instructor.

he has gotten some bad press on this site, but I rather enjoyed his class.  He definitely knows what he is talking about, but his laid back attitude may bother some students that might be wrapped too tight.  I would take him again.  Ilearned a lot.
Probably the dryest lectures I have ever sat through.  No textbook, so if you don't like going to class, don't take this teacher.

Dr. Mathisen is knowledgable, and well spoken.  But, I'm still not certain I am going to take much away from this class.  Gather your group early and get with people you know will perform, the alternative will cause you to have a long semester!
No Comments
